website_summaries.verdict: Consider these dryer balls if you don't like the idea of using those made of wool. However, they come with some longevity concerns.
pros: Made of non-toxic plastic material with soft "spikes" that soften clothes naturally
You get 4 large balls for a reasonable price
cons: Balls may split in half with wear and tear from frequent use
Not as effective when used with large fabrics like blankets and sheets

customer_reviews.title: Whitmor dryer balls
customer_reviews.text: Have been using these about a month now and so far as I can tell the clothes come out feeling the same as when we used dryer sheets. They’re a soft rubbery material and don’t make any more noise than what is already there. I was worried about some types reviewed as hard plastic as noisy but that’s not an issue with these. Planning on getting another set to have a few more tumbling around. The only ‘issue’ I’ve had is the dogs thinking these are toys and taking off with them but no issues with the product itself.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Just used them for the first time, did not ...
customer_reviews.text: Just used them for the first time, did not use fabric softener sheets. Not sure it decreased my drying time, I never paid attention to anything but the buzzer when the cycle is finished. I bought these thinking to save money on not needing the dryer sheets. Every load has come out full of static. Product claimed to not need them, which is why I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Schumechan

customer_reviews.title: Don’t purchase.
customer_reviews.text: All my laundry came out of the drye filled with static cling. Item did not work at all. So disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Sunflower435

customer_reviews.title: Actually dry clothes!
customer_reviews.text: We moved into our house 5 years ago and have had issues with our dryer not drying efficiently; to the point where we have to separate a normal load of laundry into 3 loads of drying. I got these as a "nothing else works, why not" but I had no intention of them actually helping. Well, I was wrong! These are amazing! I am not sure how they do it, but somehow they actually help dry the clothes. We can now put a normal load of clothes into the dryer, and we don't have to divide them, or run the dryer 3-4 times to dry! Even if we get a new dryer, I will always use these. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: These are great to fluff down comforter in the dryer and soften ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great to fluff down comforter in the dryer and soften regular clothes. I hate the smell of fabric softener. I use white vinegar and 4 drops of eucalyptus oil in the fabric softener compartment of washer. And put these in the dryer. Clothes come out soft and smell neutral. I don't smell either the vinegar or the eucalyptus. Maybe they cancel each other out.
customer_reviews.author: VideoJoy

customer_reviews.title: No difference in static with or without them
customer_reviews.text: Was trying to avoid using dryer sheets. No difference with or without them. In my experience do not reduce static. In my experience there is no difference in how dry or damp a blanket is with or without these. Static occurs when the clothes are dry and still being heated and tumbled. Stopped using these and just set the dryer timer and heat setting lower.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Shopping Leads to Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Are use these for when I dry my down Columbia jacket, or when I dry things the tangle easily like sheets. They do a great job of keeping things fluffed up and untangled. I did one load of regular laundry, and tried using these without an additional dryer sheet. The results was that the clothes were extremely staticky. I would recommend these for fluffing and keeping things untangled, but don’t quit buying your dryer sheets.
customer_reviews.author: momof3dogsTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: I love these BALLS
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how long these dryer balls last, but I've used previous balls for YEARS before FINALLY replacing them & I'm in love with these dryer balls, or at least I have been. I thank the Creator for the creation of these dryer balls. They dry my clothes faster, without the need of dryer sheets, softer clothes (compared with dryer sheets)... Best of all? my clothes don't stick on my other clothing... Also, I would recommend these balls if you have sensative skin and get reactions to dryer sheets (yes, some people do!)
customer_reviews.author: Lc315_3

customer_reviews.title: They are useless!
customer_reviews.text: These did not cut down dry time. I couldn't tell that wrinkles were less. My clothes had lots of static. There is no need to use them. I still need dryer sheets. These were a total waste of money!! They might make a good dog toy!
customer_reviews.author: mfc84

customer_reviews.title: Horrrible strong Rubber smell!
customer_reviews.text: I just used these balls for the first time, taking them out of bag they had no smell but when dryer got warm/hot, I opened the dryer to turn clothes and there was this not pleasant strong Rubbery odor. I have been using the Wool dryer balls for a while now with absolutely no Extra smell, don't know if the balls really make drying clothes faster but I use them because I understand the concept of hot air circulating under clothes. I bought these instead of the wool dryer balls since there was a huge review. I will not use them again, maybe the smell is from being they are brand new, don't want to take the risk.
customer_reviews.author: bj2006

customer_reviews.title: Eh, not really worth it unless you just like hearing them bang around in your dryer.
customer_reviews.text: I like using dryer balls instead of messing with fabric softener, but I honestly haven't seen much of a difference using these. My clothes still come out stuck together due to static electricity, and while my sweaters and towels don't come out all pilly-like, there also wasn't any noticeable softness when not using them. Finally, we did not notice any improvement in drying time when using these.
customer_reviews.author: sapph1retw1n

customer_reviews.title: Must-have for small loads
customer_reviews.text: These are a must-have if you frequently dry small loads. As most know, small loads don't dry well, as the clothes get bunched up against the edge of the dryer drum and just get spun around in the same place, without actually tumbling. That requires much longer drying time and the clothes come out all wrinkled. These balls bounce around, constantly knocking pieces of clothes out of this "stuck" position and forcing them to tumble. This results in faster drying time and significantly fewer/smaller wrinkles (almost none). Totally worth it. Will update this review if they ever split in half as others have mentioned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke in half after a month and a half
customer_reviews.text: They worked well for a month but after having these only since mid June- 2 of them have literally broke in half while I was drying a light load. I have a pair that I bought 2 years ago from Bed Bath and Beyond that are still in tact. The pictures show how I found them in the dryer. Cheap quality.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Worth their money
customer_reviews.text: I bought the dryer balls to fluff my towels. I use dryer sheets and will continue to use them. I just needed something to make my towels fluffier since dryer sheets alone wont do the trick. It appears that the clothes come out a tat bit softer. And the smell from the dryer sheet is a bit more intense than without the balls. The noise is not as loud as some of the reviews state but if you have a really small load of course they will bounce more and make more noise. All in all it is a good product.
customer_reviews.author: claudia p.

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: These dryer balls are amazing!. Not only do they help dry the clothes quicker, they also help remove dog hair. I've found since using them that I need to use the link roller less. Also, unlike others I am not bothered by the sound they make when rolling around - they are certainly quieter than tennis balls.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Like my other dryer balls
customer_reviews.text: I had some dryer balls that I got years ago, and I really liked them, but they broke eventually. These are similar to them. No smell. Great at helping the laundry move more in the dryer for quicker and more complete drying.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Farnbach

customer_reviews.title: Watch out what you ask for!
customer_reviews.text: If there were zero stars, that would be my choice. I received these things in hopes it would help with my sheets being a mess out of the dryer. "RIGHT ON THE OUTSIDE OF THE PACKAGE IT SAID SOMETHING LIKE, "NOT ABLE TO BE SOLD IN CA. BECAUSE THE CHEMICALS USED HAVE BEEN PROVEN TO CAUSE CANCER". I put them right in the trash. just sayin.....
customer_reviews.author: NOT VERY HAPPY GIRL

customer_reviews.title: Wish they were a little bigger
customer_reviews.text: I am not really sure if these work or not. I wish they were a little bigger. They are about the size of a stress ball. I have done a lot of laundry with them. I just really don’t notice anything special about my laundry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: July 2019 -Purchases these back in February and still working well. All of the balls are still in great condition as well. Bought these as I had 2 others I bought from bed bath and beyond that stopped working as well. The two I originally had are tough and adding in these soft balls really helps with the wrinkles and static. Static some days will be higher to weather but I can work with that.
customer_reviews.author: NewShopper

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: These are simply amazing! Some reviewers said that they are loud; I don’t feel like they are. Sure, they make a slight added noise to the drying cycle, but that’s about it. I have completely stopped using fabric softener because my clothes come out feeling fluffy soft. Also, I have noticed that my clothes do not take as long to dry as they have in the past; added bonus! I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M.

customer_reviews.title: When you have a wool allergy, these are the next best thing!
customer_reviews.text: We try to stay as eco-friendly as possible in our home, but its a challenge when you have allergies. My better half has been noticing his clothes have been feeling itchy. After switching detergents (4 times) it hit me, it was the wool dryer balls! These are the perfect substitute. They fluff our clothes up great and leave no itch behind.
customer_reviews.author: iheartmonkeyss

customer_reviews.title: Get Dry and Fluffy
customer_reviews.text: I use they in the dryer, and they work well. I was never a Fan of putting a shoe in with bedding as that the result can be iffy depending on whos shoe you use. I also like the fact they are more quite than a shoe. I an not a fan of dryer sheets but these do make a difference for normal loads with out the frgrance impated by a dryer sheet or a shoe. But I think it is is more fun to throw these at your kids and wife as they come out of the shower claiming that they need to be Dry and fluffy... May be more uses we will see.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: They're balls for the dryer!
customer_reviews.text: If your dryer needs balls, these are the balls. Based on other reviews (even though I don't have a easily-offended olfactory), I threw these in with a load in the washer to cleanse any potentially noxious fumes. I've never noticed any odor. They keep things fluffy. They help things dry faster. They're balls for the dryer.
customer_reviews.author: Ross LaBrant

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I just bought a new washer and dryer combo and didn’t want to use fabric softener because my husband has sensitive skin. I found these. They cut the drying time down and the clothes a soft. I have no sense of smell so asking my husband to smell them was a bit of a chuckle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: I tested them in my dryer but they to not prevent static electricity as claimed. As far as I can tell all that they do is make a racket. They went into the trash.
customer_reviews.author: WILLIAM S. GRAY

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for busy people
customer_reviews.text: Great product for people on a time constraint. It works well with just 2 in the dryer on not too deep wrinkles. Most silky or synthetic fabrics are best for it. Cotton is harder for it to get out deep wrinkles. If you add a ice cube it works well too.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Save money on freshness.
customer_reviews.text: These are a great money and time saver. We must stay away from products containing artificial scents. These balls make the laundry soft and al)ow air to pass through fabric so that they not only do not wrinkle, but they dry faster and fresher, too.
customer_reviews.author: Toni B.

customer_reviews.title: The other three is still holding up pretty well. It took up some color from my ...
customer_reviews.text: It works I guess. Not too sure how it would compare to not using anything at all but I always use this. I lost one already. The other three is still holding up pretty well. It took up some color from my clothes but it still keeps its form. I would probably buy again if I misplace more of these.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin H.

customer_reviews.title: End the Bounce rashes - use these dryer balls.
customer_reviews.text: 11/10/13. We have used these laundry drier balls for years now and with excellent results. They last about a year or more and we just replace them when the tips get worn down. They keep the clothes from tangling and help a bit in reducing static buildup. We started using them after a terrible experience with Bounce dryer sheets. The chemicals in Bounce are highly toxic to some people (estimates range to 30%), including us. After severe rash inflammations from our clothes touching our bodies after using the Bounce, we switched to the dryer balls on our physician's advice and the rashes ceased along with the medical expenditures for that problem.
customer_reviews.author: Thule1

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to dryer sheets
customer_reviews.text: Great alternative to dryer sheets! I use these dryer balls on loads of laundry for my newborns clothes. They’re great at getting rid of static and are good for sensitive skin as they are unscented and have no additives. The dryer balls also help soften stiff fabrics with their prickly spikes.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Redmond

customer_reviews.title: Save money and add better results!
customer_reviews.text: The only thing, they aren't scented, so if you like the extra scent of regular fabric softeners, this won't work for you. Although, my clothes smell naturally great clean. I ditched the old pricey fabric softeners and only use these now. Thanks for saving me money, for making my clothes wrinkle-free, and dry faster!
customer_reviews.author: Beatitude

customer_reviews.title: Helpful and durable.
customer_reviews.text: Great and durable. We’ve been using the same two dryer balls for five years and just lost one to damage. That’s with 1-2 loads a week except for the last year where our baby has kick that up to 2-3 loads a week. These help dry clothes faster and last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: MIrvine

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I love that they come at a good price for 4 of them! we continue to buy them because they work so well but also because I loose mine! Don't ask me how.. one time I lost one for 4 months, it was in the pocket of a hoodie in the back of the closet -__- No sent but leaves the clothes soft and wrinkle-free like advertised!
customer_reviews.author: Gragg Family Reviews 🦖

customer_reviews.title: They actually work...
customer_reviews.text: Huh. It actually works. I was skeptical but we’ve been using these (instead of the sheets) for a few months now and I have not noticed a difference! But the balls get stuck in sleeves and pant legs so you have to go hunt them down every once in a while. But worth it!
customer_reviews.author: androidmonger

customer_reviews.title: Use dryer balls
customer_reviews.text: i have been converted to the dryer ball group. I use all 4 in 1 load on the lowest heat setting and I throw in a 1/2 or 1/3 of a dryer sheet. My clothes dry in the same amount of time but in less heat.
customer_reviews.author: John Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Dryer balls save money and work better than fabric softeners!
customer_reviews.text: Dryer balls are great. I have been using the same for balls until my dog chewed them. These work very well. They don't add any fragrance and the wrinkles are gone.
customer_reviews.author: Lj from Fl

customer_reviews.title: They work great!!
customer_reviews.text: Clothes still have too much static. I threw them away and bought wool dryer balls. They work great!!!
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: These Are Great To Use When Laundering Anything Feather-Filled
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that you get four, because it's so easy to lose one of inside clothes taken from the dryer. They always seem to get caught in sleeves, pant legs or pockets. When you do find them, it's months later. I didn't have any problem with a vinyl odor emitting from these. I'm, not sure if they help dry things faster or get the wrinkles out quicker,but I don't use them for that purpose. If you wash a down coat or pillow, they work great for pumping up the feathers.
customer_reviews.author: dachsie fan

customer_reviews.title: Good durability
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been running these for close to a year now, they help soften clothes but do little to control static. They have held up well.
customer_reviews.author: andrew

customer_reviews.title: Softer and less wrinkle clothes
customer_reviews.text: I still put a couple laundry dry sheets for the smell but I can see Indeed a different with a couple dryer balls at the time I dry my laundry. I only used it once but so far so good! It makes my clothes softer and with less wrinkles. Will continue to use them.
customer_reviews.author: Yessy A

customer_reviews.title: Sorta not
customer_reviews.text: I owned something similar before but they were larger and we're stiff until heated up by the dryer. These are small and too soft. One of them is deflated. I don't see have they bounce between wet clothing.
customer_reviews.author: goodtoknow

customer_reviews.title: Very GOOD product!
customer_reviews.text: I really have enjoyed these particular dryer balls because they don't make as much noise as others I have tried. I've got to be careful my daughter's dog doesn't get ahold of these because they look like a pet toy!
customer_reviews.author: KellyO

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I am using all four balls in my dryer. I believe they work. They are so flimsy, however, that I can't imagine they will last very long. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: C. Brands

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Product - there should be a zero rating
customer_reviews.text: One of the 4 balls disintegrated after the second use in the dryer. The old ones that I had have lasted 8 years. Returned to Amazon for a refund!
customer_reviews.author: buenvida

customer_reviews.title: Again, save your money. The only thing these ...
customer_reviews.text: Again, save your money. The only thing these might do is separate the items in the dryer to dry quicker but these don't fluff or substitute for fabric softener as advertised. My dog likes to chase them. He waits by the dryer when I take out the clothes in hopes that one will drop out for him.
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: No difference.
customer_reviews.text: I simply haven't found that these dryer balls make any difference. I bought them especially because I was washing baby clothes and not using fabric softener, but I can't tell that the clothes are any softer. I've been using them for laundry in general and I haven't found that the clothes dry faster, that they have less static, or that anything is softer/fluffier. They might be making a slight difference that I'm not noticing, but I can't recommend purchasing them for an unobservable difference.
customer_reviews.author: Melody in CA

customer_reviews.title: Do what they claim...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these just to try them out... I dry all my laundry out side using a clothesline... Doing it this way leaves the laundry a little stiff... I used to use fabric softener sheets in the dryer just to take out the stiffness... I now use these dryer balls to do the job... These balls and 10 minutes on air fluff in the dryer... Leave my clothes very soft... For the price they are worth trying...
customer_reviews.author: jeff5267

customer_reviews.title: These really work!
customer_reviews.text: So glad I tried them. I got rid of the sheets that I used to use that created a film on the inside of my dryer and the dryer vent. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: Valencia Garrett

customer_reviews.title: I really like these balls
customer_reviews.text: I really like these balls. I've had other ones that were so hard I worried that my clothes would be damaged. These are soft but strong enough to do the job. Sometimes one will get stuck in a fitted sheet or sleeve of a shirt. It's okay. Just have a good laugh when it surprises you and falls out on the floor. Smile and be grateful for these little helpers.
customer_reviews.author: MariLew

customer_reviews.title: Total Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: These did nothing for my laundry except MAYBE dry time. Still had static and wrinkles. Very disappointed, especially after all the reviews and ‘how-tos’ that I read and watched
customer_reviews.author: CATHY S.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this unit.. I feel that it's just a gimmic
customer_reviews.author: DMS

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The break apart after about 3 uses, they are not worth buying
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Still full of static cling
customer_reviews.text: These did prevent some bunching and wrinkling, and may have quickened the drying time slightly, but they did not alleviate the static and my sheets came out still somewhat wrinkly and very full of static cling. Had to use a dryer sheet to get rid of the static.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You def get fewer wrinkles with just 2 in the tumbler
customer_reviews.text: They really do make your clothes softer and the come out of the dryer with fewer wrinkles. In some materials, it comes out ready to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Santini

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job
customer_reviews.text: Been using these for a few months, they work pretty well. I still get a little static here and there, but I like how i am saving money from buying dryer sheets, and how i am creating less waste. I use all four in my dryer, and my clothes and towels do come out soft.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah McClain

customer_reviews.title: My mom adores using dryer balls so much so that ...
customer_reviews.text: My mom adores using dryer balls so much so that she tends to wear them out. Eventually the items will crack apart, but that is to be expected of something made from this type of material and how much usage they go through.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Graham

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't help at all. My clothes are still very full of static.
customer_reviews.author: Zoua V Lee

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Yeah these didn't really work out the way I thought it would. I didn't notice any particular fluff in my laundry, it just ended up being something extra I need to fish out of my clothes, so I turned it into a cat toy.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Vasquez

customer_reviews.title: Not like in the picture
customer_reviews.text: I had some dryer balls for several years when one of them finally split open. The ones in the picture look like the ones I had previously. They're not! The ones I received are a darker color of blue (than pictured), have pointier ends, and have a thinner plastic outer shell. These easily cave in when you squeeze them, whereas the ones I had before wouldn't cave in. I am using them but I doubt they will last long. I wish I could find the brand that I had before.
customer_reviews.author: angie

customer_reviews.title: Didn't really work quite as expected on down comforters but not a bad product
customer_reviews.text: I bought these with the intention of using them to launder my down comforters. The down tends to clump and shift but is not really a dry clean item. I took them to the laundromat with super big washers and dryers. Ultimately, the balls are not heavy enough to really bounce around and de-clump down. On the up side... the dog really likes them.
customer_reviews.author: Les

customer_reviews.title: Laundry dries faster and fluffier.
customer_reviews.text: Laundry dries faster and fluffier. Everything is softer & less wrinkled. I like having 4, and the balls have stayed soft.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: I bought these June 29, 2019 one split already (9/15/19)
customer_reviews.text: I like these, but they don't last. I have already had one break in half. I only do 3-4 loads of laundry a week, I would have thought they would last longer. Sad, because I did like them.
customer_reviews.author: T. Mackenzie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: These work very well for us. They help with static and keep our clothes nice and soft. They also work nicely when drying something like a pillow because it is beating it and keeping it fluffy. I would recommend these to anyone who is looking for a nice alternative to buying dryer sheets constantly.
customer_reviews.author: Elizgangsta

customer_reviews.title: These are so fantastic. Should be standard issue
customer_reviews.text: These are so fantastic. Should be standard issue. Our dryer was in need of cleaning: it's time had bloated from about 40 minutes standard when we got it in about 2005 to almost 120 minutes. These cut the drying time back down to about 70 minutes. Once we cleaned the dryer, most loads are finished after about 30 minutes now. Great deal. I haven't paid much attention to any change in wrinkles, but I do notice that towels out of the dryer are often much dryer, warmer, and fluffier since we got these.
customer_reviews.author: Cailin Trimble

customer_reviews.title: Good dryer balls
customer_reviews.text: Not sure I agree that these are a static-reducer, but hey, I live in the frozen wastelands where winter indoor air is arid, and you could get static cling if you were living inside a bottle of fabric softener. I use a pair in the dryer to help de-clump laundry, and they seem to work well for that. Eventually--after more than a year--they will crack and disintegrate, which is why I bought more than two. These are working well.
customer_reviews.author: J. Laurel

customer_reviews.title: Save the Environment
customer_reviews.text: No need for dryer sheets that go into land fills and they are cheaper. These dryer balls work perfect at removing static cling. Actually help the drying process. They will outlast the dryer itself.
customer_reviews.author: G. Brown

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: I believe shirts and other thin material articles come out of the dryer with fewer wrinkles.
customer_reviews.author: SanJoseCAJack

customer_reviews.title: They do what I need
customer_reviews.text: Hey, they are dryer balls so there is not to say about them. I am not so much interested in faster drying than I am in the balls preventing clothes from bunching up while drying. So far they have worked well for this and without damaging anything or clunking around heavily in the dryer.
customer_reviews.author: Trebor

customer_reviews.title: balls are very soft and rubbery!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these to replace the old ones that we had been using for over 3 years. So far so good, no complaints. These dryer balls are very soft and rubbery themselves.
customer_reviews.author: jchen

customer_reviews.title: These Work
customer_reviews.text: These actually work to help dry clothes. Soft material doesn’t sound like you put rocks in your dryer
customer_reviews.author: John Chamberlin

customer_reviews.title: Have not seen major difference
customer_reviews.text: With respect to not needing dryer sheets, it is iffy. Half of the time the loads are ok but I still am getting static cling with other half of loads. Have tried to reduce drying time and it appears to depend on load size and type of clothing. I can save 5min on lighter loads. Heavy loads show no difference, need the same amount of time. Not sure that I will get my investment back on these.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Best thing for clothes and dryer
customer_reviews.text: These are what you should use in your dryer. Dryer sheets are terrible for your clothes and dryer do not use them. The balls are much better. The wool ones put static into your clothes. Use these they are great.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Mac

customer_reviews.title: ... they have not broken or torn and do a pretty good job
customer_reviews.text: These work well they have not broken or torn and do a pretty good job. Some of the wool ones are better but I would buy these again they are worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Work Great + Fantastic Price
customer_reviews.text: With so many of the newer fabrications for clothes requiring no dryer sheets, we use these all the time. They have held up well, we've been using for over 6months.
customer_reviews.author: Danna K.

customer_reviews.title: Getting rid of dryer sheets
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these because I am trying to get the chemicals out of my life. I wasn't sure if they would actually work, but each load of laundry I've done has come out incredibly soft. I love these things. They are also not noisy like I anticipated them being. A great solution to getting the chemical dryer sheets out and keeping my soft clothes.
customer_reviews.author: sarah anne

customer_reviews.title: Love them & my dogs do too.
customer_reviews.text: These are great for people with skin allergies. You don’t need softener. They are even better with softener especially with static electricity.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Love these. I bought some cotton ones before and they kept shedding and getting lint on clothes.
customer_reviews.author: Anita S. Ahmadi

customer_reviews.title: Nice and quiet
customer_reviews.text: The balls are soft and don’t make noise in the dryer and seem to work well.
customer_reviews.author: SassyPants

customer_reviews.title: work good
customer_reviews.text: Now I have 6 blue balls. They control static cling on most fabrics as long as you don't over dry your load. In my opinion, they don't work well with fleece.
customer_reviews.author: MattK.

customer_reviews.title: Adequate
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace two of a different brand that had self destructed. They are not as good, and half the size. The previous ones were filled with a sponge that you wet before using which made them heavier and hence more effective at fluffing the big comforter I use them for. But there are 4 of these so it seems to work o.k. and their durability is so far so good after 3 uses.
customer_reviews.author: Louis B. Crayton

customer_reviews.title: it actually works on my puffy comforter
customer_reviews.text: This product puffs up comforters - just throw them in and put dryer on
customer_reviews.author: tc5k

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Not do they help the environment, they keep my clothes lasting longer.
customer_reviews.author: Bugs

customer_reviews.title: Speeds up dry time for sure.
customer_reviews.text: These do a pretty good job at reducing fabric. My favorite thing is that these balls definitely speed up drying time by an average of 15 minutes, which is great for bedding or towels.
customer_reviews.author: Jenni

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Works
customer_reviews.text: Helps so much with keeping our sheets wrinkle free while drying. Great addition to our cleaning routine
customer_reviews.author: David M Pavlik

customer_reviews.title: A MUST-HAVE!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect---everything good written about these I concur. The drying time is shorter, the clothes have fewer to no wrinkles, and lint is almost completely gone when I use these...I do use them all at once. My mom came over when I was ill and did my laundry-she wanted me to order two sets of these [and she is super frugal-buying only basics]. So much less ironing as well. Buy these! I am going to buy some more=as it seems my kitty loves them too >.<
customer_reviews.author: Joyful IN Hope!

customer_reviews.title: Works awesome
customer_reviews.text: Just tried it last night. It was amazing~ my clothes were super soft even better than the dryer sheets, totally a life saver! Would highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: $arah

customer_reviews.title: Static cling possibly increased due to colder temperatures
customer_reviews.text: We bought this product in May and it worked perfectly until November when the outside temperatures dropped significantly. I am hoping when warmer weather returns the static cling will disappear, again. In the mean time, I would welcome any ideas for a resolution to get rid of static cling during the winter months.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Ann

customer_reviews.title: Works fine.
customer_reviews.text: A bit lighter weight than the last ones I purchased from another vendor yrs ago, but works fine.
customer_reviews.author: HollyK

customer_reviews.title: Works well in clothes dryer
customer_reviews.text: Have had for a few months and they are working as expected. Showing no signs of breaking apart.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't get rid of static
customer_reviews.text: We tried all the ways we could find online on using these balls in the dryer and still getting rid of static cling. None worked like what you're used to with the standard dryer sheets.
customer_reviews.author: AHL

customer_reviews.title: I have used these for years. Saves a lot ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used these for years. Saves a lot of money on fabric softner products. They make noise in the dryer but you also know when the load is done when there is no more thumping.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria H.

customer_reviews.title: Work as described.
customer_reviews.text: So much debate over dryer balls by Amazon customers! I finally just took a chance on these and they work exactly as they are supposed to. No problems.
customer_reviews.author: BUMPSEY

customer_reviews.title: They are fine but can't really tell a difference
customer_reviews.text: I really can't tell the difference. I don't think it hurts so I will keep using them.
customer_reviews.author: MikeC

customer_reviews.title: No more fabric sheets
customer_reviews.text: Didn't believe before I tried. Well, I tried and they work!! Haven't used fabric sheets since.
customer_reviews.author: CAF

customer_reviews.title: ... if they make things softer - but they are SUPER fun to squeeze when they're hot from the laundry
customer_reviews.text: I'm honestly not sure if they really dry laundry faster or if they make things softer - but they are SUPER fun to squeeze when they're hot from the laundry
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Mayfield

customer_reviews.title: Yes, great item!
customer_reviews.text: I've used these for many years. They help keep the time short on drying and they separate items to complete dry. Love!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michailah Williams

customer_reviews.title: Short lived
customer_reviews.text: The dryer balls did seem to help keeps things wrinkle free and to dry faster but they’ve broken apart already and I got them less than two months ago so I don’t think they’re worth it in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: Call Me Gideon

customer_reviews.title: Great for Down and Pillows
customer_reviews.text: I find the balls are great in the washer and dryer for pillows, comforters and down items. They also work well in the dryer if there is one or just a few items I'm getting wrinkles out of or drying quickly. I thought maybe these balls would reduce the need for dryer sheets but I have not found them to reduce static at all.
customer_reviews.author: Otter Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great surprising results
customer_reviews.text: Very surprised after years of scented sheets. Clothes were wrinkle free and soft!
customer_reviews.author: D. Stephenson

customer_reviews.title: forget ironing
customer_reviews.text: Amazing products. Now I dnt need to iron my cloths. My husband is happy as well. I would recommend everyone to buy this item without any doubt
customer_reviews.author: ahmed goni chowdhury

product_meta.title: Whitmor Dryer Balls - Eco Friendly Fabric Softener Alternative (Set of 4)
product_meta.description: Dryer Balls help separate clothes for faster drying times, as well as soften fabrics naturally without chemicals or toxic materials. The are durable, reusable, and easy to use. Set of 4. Whitmor is a 4th generation family-owned and operated business. Since 1946, Whitmor has been dedicated to bringing organization home by creating products that simplify everyday life. Ensuring that those products are built with integrity, value, and innovation is our commitment to you. And our promise is that we will always be here for you should you ever need us as we stand behind our product 100%. Whitmor customer service is available in English and Spanish Monday through Friday from 8am - 4:30pm CST. Call us and we will gladly assist you in your language.
feature_bullets: Tumbles in the dryer to lift and separate laundry, allowing hot air to flow more efficiently
Natural alternative to fabric softeners; dryer balls cut waste and reduce need for chemicals
Helps eliminate wrinkles, twisting, and tangling of clothes
Soft spikes massage fabrics to naturally fluff up and soften
Eliminates static cling; prevents clothes from rubbing against each other
For over 70 years, Whitmor has been bringing organization home. If you have questions or problems, please contact us for immediate assistance

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
